content: Chickenhawk Obama is trying to act like he is a world leader when all he is is a community organizer. By PETER BAKER, NY Times Published: April 13, 2009 WASHINGTON — President Obama vowed Monday to “halt the rise of piracy” off the coast of Africa following the dramatic rescue of an American merchant captain, foreshadowing a longer and potentially more treacherous struggle ahead as he weighs a series of problematic options. With the “Black Hawk Down” episode in Somalia in 1993, where two American helicopters were shot down and 18 American soldiers were killed, still in the American consciousness, Mr. Obama and his advisers are wary of becoming deeply involved in the region again. That wariness comes at a time when Mr. Obama is already trying end a war in Iraq and win another in Afghanistan. “All I can tell you is I am confident we will be spending a lot of time in the Situation Room over the next few weeks trying to figure out what in the world to do about this problem,” Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates told students and faculty members at the Marine Corps War College in Quantico, Va., according to a military news service. One friggin victory and Obama is a war hero.

content: quote: "So now American sailors will have to die so shipping companies can make lots of money. Good going Barry. Mission accomplished!" Good going President Obama, US Navy and Captain R. Phillips. Don't know what BO had to do with the entire effort but he did not 'screw up' the Navy's mission and his remarks do appear that he was on top of the situation. He didn't do the 'Republican thing' or the 'Democratic thing'; he did the American thing (not back off because of threats, etc.). I've listened to a number of commentators saying either he waited too long or his 'allowing' the Navy to use "deadly force" will cause dire consequences to the shipping, travel, and foreign diplomacy but what I "know" is that he has sent a message that you don't 'mess' (or stronger term) with the USA! Piracy like terrorism is a threat not only to the US but to the world and the big kid on the block has said "We Have Had Enough!" ... and our Navy hasn't really had a Sea battle since WWII. Any bets on how a Pirate ship will fare against one of our ships ?

content: Chickenhawk Obama is trying to act like he is a world leader when all he is is a community organizer. By PETER BAKER, NY Times Published: April 13, 2009 WASHINGTON — President Obama vowed Monday to “halt the rise of piracy” off the coast of Africa following the dramatic rescue of an American merchant captain, foreshadowing a longer and potentially more treacherous struggle ahead as he weighs a series of problematic options. With the “Black Hawk Down” episode in Somalia in 1993, where two American helicopters were shot down and 18 American soldiers were killed, still in the American consciousness, Mr. Obama and his advisers are wary of becoming deeply involved in the region again. That wariness comes at a time when Mr. Obama is already trying end a war in Iraq and win another in Afghanistan. “All I can tell you is I am confident we will be spending a lot of time in the Situation Room over the next few weeks trying to figure out what in the world to do about this problem,” Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates told students and faculty members at the Marine Corps War College in Quantico, Va., according to a military news service. One friggin victory and Obama is a war hero.

content: quote: "So now American sailors will have to die so shipping companies can make lots of money. Good going Barry. Mission accomplished!" Good going President Obama, US Navy and Captain R. Phillips. Don't know what BO had to do with the entire effort but he did not 'screw up' the Navy's mission and his remarks do appear that he was on top of the situation. He didn't do the 'Republican thing' or the 'Democratic thing'; he did the American thing (not back off because of threats, etc.). I've listened to a number of commentators saying either he waited too long or his 'allowing' the Navy to use "deadly force" will cause dire consequences to the shipping, travel, and foreign diplomacy but what I "know" is that he has sent a message that you don't 'mess' (or stronger term) with the USA! Piracy like terrorism is a threat not only to the US but to the world and the big kid on the block has said "We Have Had Enough!" ... and our Navy hasn't really had a Sea battle since WWII. Any bets on how a Pirate ship will fare against one of our ships ?
quote: "So now American sailors will have to die so shipping companies can make lots of money. Good going Barry. Mission accomplished!"

content: quote: "So now American sailors will have to die so shipping companies can make lots of money. Good going Barry. Mission accomplished!" Good going President Obama, US Navy and Captain R. Phillips. Don't know what BO had to do with the entire effort but he did not 'screw up' the Navy's mission and his remarks do appear that he was on top of the situation. He didn't do the 'Republican thing' or the 'Democratic thing'; he did the American thing (not back off because of threats, etc.). I've listened to a number of commentators saying either he waited too long or his 'allowing' the Navy to use "deadly force" will cause dire consequences to the shipping, travel, and foreign diplomacy but what I "know" is that he has sent a message that you don't 'mess' (or stronger term) with the USA! Piracy like terrorism is a threat not only to the US but to the world and the big kid on the block has said "We Have Had Enough!" ... and our Navy hasn't really had a Sea battle since WWII. Any bets on how a Pirate ship will fare against one of our ships ?
quote: "So now American sailors will have to die so shipping companies can make lots of money. Good going Barry. Mission accomplished!"
reply: Good going President Obama, US Navy and Captain R. Phillips. Don't know what BO had to do with the entire effort but he did not 'screw up' the Navy's mission and his remarks do appear that he was on top of the situation. He didn't do the 'Republican thing' or the 'Democratic thing'; he did the American thing (not back off because of threats, etc.). I've listened to a number of commentators saying either he waited too long or his 'allowing' the Navy to use "deadly force" will cause dire consequences to the shipping, travel, and foreign diplomacy but what I "know" is that he has sent a message that you don't 'mess' (or stronger term) with the USA! Piracy like terrorism is a threat not only to the US but to the world and the big kid on the block has said "We Have Had Enough!" ... and our Navy hasn't really had a Sea battle since WWII. Any bets on how a Pirate ship will fare against one of our ships ?

content: I don't get it. Why is it the "no blood for oil" sloganeers don't jump on the "no blood for cargo" slogan? Why is it one president can't go to war for oil while another one can go to war over cargo? Why is it one chickenhawk president can't go after a dangerous dictator but a chicken-chicken president can go after dangerous pirates? Obama is a community organizer. What makes him a briliant international policy expert or war planner? That he kept silent and basically said "you take care of it and get back to me" gives us a good indication of what is to come.
